summary: This is episode proved that Dany is the cliche Faux-Feminist who claims all women should have each other's back, despite the...
question: This is episode proved that Dany is the cliche Faux-Feminist who claims all women should have each other's back, despite the fact they may have different goals and opinions. She tried to use the female leadership card to bond with Sansa but would not even think about granting Northern Independence. Also, she totally forgot the last time she allied with another group of powerful women (Ellaria, Olenna, Yara) and left them to rot when they proved a hindrance to her goals.
answer:
Hi!

Agree! Agree! Agree!

Daenerys didn’t even want to go to Sansa on her own accord. She’s been angry at her ever since they met because Sansa isn’t showing Daenerys enough “Respect” which basically translate to Sansa not willing to kiss Daenerys ass from the moment they met. She really attempted to try and smooth things over with trying to find common ground of “female rule” this could have been a moment for Daenerys character to show she respects what Sansa has achieved. She’s not like Cersei, her power has come from the love and respect she has of her people. Something Daenerys feels she has too. So, why should she have any problems with this bad ass female ruler to do what’s best for her people? Yara was another strong ass female ruler and Daenerys was amused and intrigued their entire meeting and even agreed the Iron Islands could rule itself after they win. But for some reason, she is unable to do this with Sansa. How couldn’t she see where she’s coming from? Daenerys is all about freedom, right? All about “Making your own choices” but this is selective freedom when the North doesn’t want to bend to anyone else. This is what she had a problem with. Daenerys is a tyrant. And tyrants don’t like when they aren’t immediately obeyed. If Daenerys wasn’t a conqueror, if she truly wanted to “break the wheel.” Which used to be perceived as a more democratic system of government, then this should be ok with her. These people want their own freedom but because she’s unable to admit she just wants herself on top with all the other houses crushed, she hits a snag and would never allow this. Daenerys doesn’t really give two shits at the end of the day about female rule. She had all three women of powerful houses as her allies and she didn’t lift a finger to save them or even inquire about their safety or release. Once they were unable to be of use to her, they no longer mattered in her eyes. Self awareness is key in a ruler and Daenerys lacks even an ounce of it.

summary: i know people are getting annoyed with my 'no one is treating sansa right' but no one is treating sansa right. bran and sansa...
question: i know people are getting annoyed with my 'no one is treating sansa right' but no one is treating sansa right. bran and sansa aren't sharing scenes, we're supposed to forget the winterhell scenes from last season just like that, jon is a dick. why should i care about the 'pack survives' when the pack is struggling with basic respect
answer:
Liiiiisten. My investment in the “pack” and House Stark in general post Robb/Cat’s deaths is pretty much just Sansa and a pinch of Bran, depending on how bad the writing is for him that episode. All this talk of the pack this, Stark siblings that, and they can’t even get a single scene together after they all reunite after years of hell? Last night on earth and they’d rather spend it with anyone else (as sweet as the Sansa/Theon scene was) but each other?

It’s mostly just bad writing though, like everything else on this terrible show lol. Arya’s character was made a joke last season, threatening her sister’s life just for some moronic plot “twist” everyone with two eyes saw coming. To make up for it and show that she and Sansa do have a bond, they turn to diminish Sansa and Jon’s relationship by having him be a prick so Arya can defend her. It’s frustrating because it’s so easy to have a the Stark kids in a scene together and show how deep their connection is, without a single dialogue, just the four of them in each other’s presence. Literally twenty seconds and it’s done. But there’s no time for that apparently. CGI dragons aren’t going to take themselves for a joyride.

summary: jon has been terrible to sansa. with the exception of their interactions in 6x04 & 6x05, him choking littlefinger and him...
question: jon has been terrible to sansa. with the exception of their interactions in 6x04 & 6x05, him choking littlefinger and him dumping his responsibilities on sansa, he doesn't behave like he thinks sansa is worthy respecting. the arya thing is in character imo. his constant demands of validation is so annoying to me because he never validates sansa. he could have said thank you for running the north at least
answer:
S6 Jon did his best, it’s what had me rooting for him after seasons of apathy and loving his relationship with Sansa, despite them being the Stark sibling duo I least considered. He was still stubborn and stupid but he at least tried. He tried to protect her, help her, listen to her (albeit too late). What was the point of that 6x10 scene where he credits her for the victory of TBotB and stresses the importance of mutual trust, of Sansa affirming his place as a Stark, just for him to pull this shit all over again? It’s actually quite funny how it turns out he’s hurt that she- being his family- didn’t immediately side with him on his decision to become Daenerys’s full time bedwarmer, when by his own logic as Arya reminded him, he should take Sansa’s side in this dispute with Daenerys because he’s her family too?

And for real, a thanks would kill nobody. But unless it’s to whine or profess attraction to his paternal aunt, Japleno Salad can’t fix his mouth to say shit :(

tags: I know no queen but the queen in the north whose name is stark
summary: I honestly feel a bit sorry for Dani. The creators are really dogpiling on her with the whole "Sansa is the real queen here"...
body:
I honestly feel a bit sorry for Dani. The creators are really dogpiling on her with the whole “Sansa is the real queen here” thing.

Like sure, I love it and I knew this would happen (why wouldn’t the girl listening to her followers and preparing to share food be preferred to the one who’s expecting to take away the independence the Northerners worked hard to get?) but dang. Dark!Dany is coming out strong in two episodes after whole seasons of the show going “Yass, queen!” to all her accomplishments.

summary: Review - Game of Thrones S08EP2: "A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms" — Word of The Nerd
title: Review - Game of Thrones S08EP2: "A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms" — Word of The Nerd
excerpt: In this Game of Thrones episode, the White Walkers approach is near, everyone chooses how to spend their final night and Brienne gets what she's earned.
description:
Hello wonderful readers, it’s been a while. I’ll be taking on the even number reviews in this final Game of Thrones season.

I enjoyed this episode a lot but it was a strange episode. A friend of mine made a comment that both this episode and the previous one were set up episodes.

Episode one which we reviewed here, is the set up for Starks while this was the set up for everyone else. It sort of makes sense, but also slightly terrifies me because it means the next ep will really be a punch in the gut.

For now, we’ll talk about what isn’t great and move on to what I love. And as always

Winterhell 2.0

There are some parts of this episode which are bizarre. No, I’m not talking about Tormund’s weird stories. The show has dangled Jon’s paternity in our faces for eight years and yet there’s no reaction.

                                                   Read the Rest

blog.title: Direwolf, Direwolf what do you see?

tags: had to make a gifset of this quote with sansa in her armor lmao
summary: She wondered where this courage had come from, to speak to him so frankly. From Winterfell, she thought. I am stronger within...
caption:
She wondered where this courage had come from, to speak to him so frankly. From Winterfell, she thought. I am stronger within the walls of Winterfell.

-Sansa VII, A Storm of Swords

Our goal is to provide inspiration and quality sansan art, fanfiction recommendations , edits, meta, discussion, confessions, head canons and prompts for you.♡ We tag NSFW content. tags: the fanfiction the show has become
grrm says only the books are canon
summary: Why don't we have a SanSan reunion? Can't understand it and it saddens me :(
question: Why don't we have a SanSan reunion? Can't understand it and it saddens me :(
answer:
I think it’s possible that it’s coming. Since the writers aren’t feeding us, I have invented my own storyline for Sandor.

My head canon is that show!Sandor wouldn’t seek out Sansa as Lady of Winterfell for a few reasons:

  • Fear he will be rejected by Sansa, it’s enough to be close to her
  • Afraid that she associates him with Joffrey, and
  • he doesn’t want to be forced to leave Winterfell
  • He’s not gonna risk getting judged by a Targaryen with two dragons (because fire) just to satisfy his desire for closeness
  • He doesn’t think he’s going to survive so what’s the point of reacquainting and building a friendship with her only to leave (die) once again.
  • He can’t bear to fail her a second time

Now after the battle for Winterfell, we know there’s going to be significantly less people for Sansa to keep council with, and she’s going to need help.

Side note: Sandor will almost certainly survive the battle because the show writers have an obsession with Cleganebowl and they need a way to get Sandor to KL (which I hate but that’s another thing).

This will be when we’ll see a reunion, if there is one. Arya will recommend Sandor to shield Sansa (that’s the point of him telling Arya in S3 that he saved Sansa, and their reunion in 8x02, Arya seeing him changed and Sandor saying he fought for her? idk). He may pledge himself to Sansa if they decide on more fanservice, where he can be a true knight for her.

When the writers decide Sansa needs to go south, Sandor will take her and Arya both, because she still needs to cross off Cersei from her list and there’s no way Arya would allow Sansa anywhere near Cersei.

So there it is: Sansa gets to confront Cersei. Arya gets her opportunity to kill her.

Sandor gets redemption for keeping them both safe and the writers get the setup for Cleganebowl.

Even if sansan doesn’t happen on the show, it is canon and GRRM ships it. And we still have TWOW and ADOS.

summary: 10 Thoughts I Had When Watching GOT S8E2
body:
10 Thoughts I Had When Watching GOT S8E2

1. MY BABY BRIENNE DEFENDING HER HUBBY!


2. Do you want me to insult you?


3. I love how stealing books is a part of what makes Sam badass.


4. I think I want Sansa to be Queen.


5. The Gendrya ship has set sail.


6. Jamie and Brienne will cause my heart to explode.


7. Maybe I’m ready to forgive Theon.


8. Bran’s creepy stare is scarier than the Night King


9. As if Pod wasn’t perfect enough. He sings!


10. SER BRIENNE OF TARTH.

summary: When did we start shipping Sansa and Theon? Like... what? It’s not like I’m against it. Am I? What? Has there been any chemistry...
body: When did we start shipping Sansa and Theon? Like… what? It’s not like I’m against it. Am I? What? Has there been any chemistry between them? Has anybody shipped them before this episode? Are we even shipping them? What. Is. Happening.

reblog.comment: When did we start shipping Sansa and Theon? Like… what? It’s not like I’m against it. Am I? What? Has there been any chemistry between them? Has anybody shipped them before this episode? Are we even shipping them? What. Is. Happening.

trail.content_raw: When did we start shipping Sansa and Theon? Like… what? It’s not like I’m against it. Am I? What? Has there been any chemistry between them? Has anybody shipped them before this episode? Are we even shipping them? What. Is. Happening.
trail.content: When did we start shipping Sansa and Theon? Like… what? It’s not like I’m against it. Am I? What? Has there been any chemistry between them? Has anybody shipped them before this episode? Are we even shipping them? What. Is. Happening.

blog.name: ladycyprus
blog.title: Sansan Forever by Lady Cyprus
blog.description: Shameless Sansan shipping and miscellaneous fandom fuckery. Sandor Clegane, Sansa Stark and Sansan meta, fanart and fanfiction. Welcome to hell, sweet summer child. Sansan shippers make the very best company.

summary: Are you from Cyprus?
question: Are you from Cyprus?
answer:
Thanks for the ask Nonny.  No, I’m not from Cyprus. 

My blog, URL and avatar are inspired by my love of the Sandor Clegane and Sansa Stark (or Sansan) pairing.  My avatar is Venus, the Roman goddess of love, beauty and procreation.  Venus from The Birth of Venus by Sandro Botticelli is my Sansa headcanon, which is why I picked it for an avatar.  Venus’s Grecian equivalent Aphrodite was born from sea foam on the Isle of Cyprus and is referred to in certain sects as the Lady of Cyprus, which is how I selected my URL.  I’m all about the love, and to me, the Sansan pairing represents the healing power of love and compassion.  Sansa is my Queen of Love and Beauty.
